attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: Vaccinate badgers instead of culling
attributes.background: The Government have decided to extend the culling area and increasing deaths. This is based of little evidence and is destroying ecosystems. Why not just vaccinate them if it's a problem?
attributes.additional_details:
Also it is estimated that 6% of bTB cases amongst cattle are as a direct result of badgers, which is a small amount, so why not just vaccinate a few!
Sources:
https://www.badger.org.uk/can-the-cull

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-41228693

http://www.chesterstandard.co.uk/home/2017/09/13/gallery/wildlife-trust-is-opposed-to-badger-cull-in-cheshire-95089/

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children’s development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Ban gambling advertising in the UK.
attributes.background: I am 26 years old and I already know over ten people who have been near crippled by gambling addiction. The fact that gambling is advertised is disgusting and should be held in the same regard as other addictive substances which get abused by people with poor mental health.
attributes.additional_details: The adverts that we see on the television take advantage of people's weaknesses, use of apps in spare time, inability to be alone or bored and position gambling as a 'light-hearted', 'sociable' way of passing the time. The actual potential that gambling had to ruin people's lives and the lives of their families and friends is catastrophic. There needs to be more onus placed on centralised government's responsibility to stopping this happening.

attributes.action: All pet abductors, ransomers, and thieves to get mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.background: They are as much of our family as our sons and daughters. Thieves, blackmailers, breeders, course hunters etc are stealing to order knowing the overstretched police have little resources to tackle this type of crime. VOTE NOW!
attributes.additional_details: If you had a pet you'd know what to do.

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.

attributes.action: Fit all Heavy or Large Vehicles with Automatic Emergency Braking System (AEBS)
attributes.background: Horrific HGV accidents happen constantly. Automatic emergency braking systems could prevent many deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Humans are subject to fatigue, 'highway hypnosis', sudden medical problems and distractions. Automatic emergency brakes are not subject to any of these problems. According to Campaign For Better Transport: More than half (52%) of fatal accidents on motorways involve HGVs but only 10% of motorway vehicles are HGVs. HGVs are also involved in 1 in 5 fatal crashes on A and minor roads, and its worsening each year. Let's reverse this trend and use technology to prevent more deaths.

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged £140 for emergency consultation, to update the database £17 and admit the pet to hospital £200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled £702.04. A further £700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing £240. 
The total cost was £1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over £3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Education Compulsory in UK Schools
attributes.background: Despite increasingly high rates of mental illness in young people, mental health education isn’t compulsory in UK schools. Education is a vital component in increasing knowledge and awareness, encouraging open discussion among young people and giving them the power to ask for help when they need it.
attributes.additional_details:
Our initial campaign commissioned 2 polls:

• 80% of British parents believe child mental health is a top concern & 79% believe children should be taught about mental health (YouGov)
• 92% of 14-18 y/o think mental health should be taught at school. 65% said lack of knowledge meant they wouldn’t know if they were having issues (Censuswide)

Over 30 UK clinical psychologists & psychiatrists wrote to the government to make mental health education compulsory (The Times)

www.headucationuk.org
attributes.creator_name: Hannah Trimble, on behalf of The Shaw Mind Foundation

attributes.action: Eliminate financial requirement for UK citizens bringing legal spouses to the UK
attributes.background: Currently EU citizens can settle their non-EU spouses in the UK on proof of a legal marriage. For UK citizens there are additional income or capital requirements. These additional requirements discriminate against UK citizens and can prevent resettlement of their non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules for British citizens to bring non-EU spouses to the UK are forcing some to have to leave the UK or abandon their spouse. The Government should be looking after these citizens above all others. British citizens shouldn't have to face this government imposed dilemma of choosing between their spouse and their country.
 
This petition proposes the elimination of the income and capital hurdles that discriminate against UK citizens settling their legal spouses in the UK.

attributes.action: Move PMQ's to prime time on Tuesdays
attributes.background:
Prime Minister's Questions should be moved from 12pm on Wednesday to Tuesday evenings.

This will increase the amount of people able to watch PMQ's and participate in democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest Tuesdays as the best day as there aren't other popular shows on on a Tuesday, increasing the audience.

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax on applicable products to help battle climate change.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on products that are increasing the levels of carbon dioxide in the earths atmosphere. Offset the tax by reducing others on products/services that are better for the environment making it financially beneficial for people to make the right decisions on what they buy.
attributes.additional_details: This kind of tax would be similar to car tax in the way that an engine with lower emission levels is cheaper than one that has a higher level, and cars such as those powered by electricity have zero tax. This would make healthier foods more attainable to people and junk food more expensive, thus improving the publics health reducing the strain on services like the NHS. Another example, electricity provided by companies using renewable technologies would be cheaper than those using fossil fuels.

attributes.action: Revise to Abortion Act to allow women to take medical abortion pills at home.
attributes.background: Currently, women are required to take abortion pills at a medical clinic due to the outdated Abortion Act of 1967. This means that women often begin the painful process in public or whilst travelling. This could be easily avoided if the Act was amended to allow women to take the pills at home.
attributes.additional_details: The Abortion Act of 1967 states that any abortion must take place in a medical clinic. Since this Act was passed, medical abortions have become possible, and now make up 2/3 of abortions. Due to the Act, women have to travel to a clinic twice within 48 hours. It is not medically necessary to take these pills in a clinic, this is simply enforced as a due to the strict terms of the 1967 Act. Consequently, many women unnecessarily begin this painful process in public or whilst travelling.

attributes.action: Stop NHS Surcharge Payment for Visa applications (NI contributions goes to NHS)
attributes.background: The Home Office has made it mandatory for immigrants to pay for NHS Surcharge as part of Visa application while working immigrants in the UK pay National Insurance contribution that fund other state benefits and the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Surcharge cost £200 per year and this means immigrants have to pay an excess of £200 every time they apply to renew their Visa on top of their high visa charge. For someone applying for 5 years visa, this will amount to an extra £1000. National Insurance contribution means that immigrants are already paying contribution towards funding the NHS and should be given the right to access medical treatment and not treated differently from EU and UK citizens with regards to accessing the NHS

attributes.action: Ban mobile operators from taking payments for phone purchases you've paid off.
attributes.background: Monthly payments for a new mobile contract will often include the service charges and a cost to cover a new phone. Once your contract term expires, and if you do not contact the operator, you will automatically continue paying the same monthly cost despite having paid off the loan for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is the same as buying a new car on finance and being expected to continue your payments once the loan is paid off. 

The majority of consumers may be aware of the practice and renegotiate their contracts, however, many others do not realise that part of their monthly cost is effectively a loan for the phone. 

Standard industry practice should be to automatically move consumers to SIM only when their contract expires or phone is paid off, whichever occurs first.

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/oriental-eye-worm-infection-dogs-blindness-spread-uk-thelazia-callipaeda-a7955711.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-4901936/UK-pets-owners-risk-blinding-eye-infection.html

attributes.action: Require routine scans for head and neck cancer patients after remission
attributes.background: Head and neck cancer patients are not routinely scanned after remission due to protocol. Even though a certain amount of patients have had metastasis from this source of cancer, which has gone from a highly curable cancer to a terminal diagnosis. Scans every 3-6 months should be a requirement.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 Andrew Davis was diagnosed with SCC of the tonsil. He underwent 30 radiotherapy and 1 chemotherapy. He was then given the all clear in June 2016. After this his life started to get better. In June 2017, Andrew became unwell and was given the news he had Secondary Liver Mets, no evidence of disease in head and neck area but the cells in his liver were from that source that had broken away during treatment. We are petitioning for head and neck patients to be scanned routinely.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from being able to withhold medicines on the grounds of beliefs
attributes.background: I’ve recently heard several women’s experiences of being withheld contraceptive medicines like the morning after pill because of pharmacists' personal beliefs.
attributes.additional_details: Through these experiences, many women are going home and worrying about possible pregnancy. In the health and social care industry, care and treatment cannot be withheld due to the personal beliefs of staff as it would be a violation of human rights. It shouldn’t be okay for pharmacists to withhold medicines from women on this basis - providing medicine and treatment for contraceptive purposes is a large role of a Pharmacist and failing to provide these is a failure in a first world country.

attributes.action: Limit motorway road works to 1 junction at a time.
attributes.background: With the current influx of “smart” motorways being installed around the country, we have seen neverending roadworks for miles and miles. The current spate of roadworks on the M6 between Jncs 19 and 16 are causing mayhem and misery daily. Accidents occur daily and yet work won’t be done till 2019
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing the government stop Highways England from installing road works for more than one junction at a time. Where the next junction is longer than 5 miles away then the limit be 5 miles. The lanes are too narrow and the lack of a hard shoulder in the inevitable outcome of an incident impedes emergency services and creates hours of tail backs. All to help protect workers which is all well and good if they were actually working on that stretch.

attributes.action: Give all National Health workers free parking and free public transport.
attributes.background: for the last seven years National Health workers have had a pay freeze. But are still expected to pay parking fees to park at work which can be anything up to 10% of their wages, by giving them all free parking and free public transport.This would be like giving them a 5-6% pay rise

attributes.action: Make it that front number plates do not have to be shown on a motor vehicle
attributes.background: Make it so that on a motor vehicle that you don’t have to display a front number plate.

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay £8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: To reopen Weston-Super-Mare's A&E between 10pm and 8am
attributes.background: W-S-M, A&E shut on July 4th 2017 due to the fragility of the emergency services due of the lack of senior doctors. At least 27 people use the emergency services each night; from those, 12 are transported by ambulance. Not having their local A&E at their disposal is endangering their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
One resident of Weston Super Mare stated,"We need our local A&E back. The delays encountered by ambulances having trawl between Taunton and Bristol are endangering lives."It's vital to keep this facility open 24 hours 7 days a week."
Another said..
"Please sign.. we need our local services. Bristol and Taunton are too far away, for the person having to care for them, for the ambulance service having to trawl back and forth and waiting times for ambulance services are endangering lives."

attributes.action: Rid the TV licence fee for all students living away from home
attributes.background: Although often living on money provided by government or guardians, students in the UK are still expected to pay for their television licence. Many students already find it difficult to budget their living costs without this extra outgoing.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph states that, due to a recent change in the law, 'Magistrates will also be permitted to apply their discretion in situations where the defendant had been experiencing "significant financial hardship" at the time due to "exceptional circumstances".'

Students are often in some sort of financial hardship and are refused the luxury of watching television whilst in uni merely because they cannot afford this.

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Allow  frontline ambulance staff to carry CS gas / or pepper spray
attributes.background: With the increase on assaults in the nhs and both ambulance services . It would be benificial to make it optional for ambulance workers on the frontline to carry some form or procetion/self defence equipment.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down. Drivers should be required to retake their test every 5 years after they turn 65.

attributes.action: Demand a formal independence referendum for Catalonia
attributes.background: The behaviour of the Spanish national police and Guardia Civil in relation to the Catalonian independence referendum is shocking and has no place in a Western democracy. The British government should stand with the Catalan people and demand a free and fair referendum on their independence from Spain
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/01/dozens-injured-as-riot-police-storm-catalan-ref-polling-stations

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-41461032

The Spanish authorities have undertaken what amounts to a violent crackdown on people attempting to exercise their democratic right to self-determination. Even the court findings that the vote is illegal do not justify violence by police against peaceful citizens.

attributes.action: Have a general election before summer term 2018
attributes.background: At this time of political uncertainty, Britain needs to have a clear leader and a strong party to back them up. At the moment, the country doesn’t have a party with a strong mandate or a certain one. I believe that we need a chance for all political parties to present to us their arguments.
attributes.additional_details: So that we can decided clearly and indecisively who runs The U.K. This last general election failed us. The Conservative party clearly Expected to win and didn’t present their side, and labour fought but didn’t give a clear plan for their brexit, however now that Labour, like the Conservatives, have clarified their brexit strategy we, the British people deserve to make a choice, to benefit is locally and nationally.

attributes.action: Carbon monoxide detectors in student accommodation and lettings
attributes.background:
My daughter has just moved into a student flat were we found no carbon monoxide detectors, which I thought would be a legal requirement. But after speaking to the letting company they told me that they there's no legal requirement for them.
We all know the consequences of a carbon monoxide leak...
attributes.additional_details:
This is what I received from Save the Student when I put the question to them regarding the law...
They are only legally required for any room containing a solid fuel burning appliance, and not for Gas appliances. However gas boilers can emit carbon monoxide, and the government say "we would expect and encourage reputable landlords to ensure that working carbon monoxide alarms are installed in rooms with gas boilers". So we advise you put strong pressure on the agent to do the right thing.

attributes.action: Stop mortgage interest support benefit changes.
attributes.background:
Next April the mortgage interest benefits support change to become a loan. This will make life even more difficult for the claimants relying on this benefit.

It means that more people could lose their homes, in turn needing to find rental properties and claiming housing benefits.

attributes.action: Tighten the regulations on who can give Botox
attributes.background:
At the moment anyone can administer Botox after it has been prescribed.
I think only medical professionals should be able to administer Botox into clients.
e.g. Doctors, surgeons, dentists and nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently had a procedure done by an unqualified person who then left my face drooping down and paralysed.  I am one of many women who have suffered.  
Botox is a controlled substance this has to be prescribed by a doctor dentist or nurse prescriber.  At the moment who injects the Botox after this can be any one with no medical background. The dangers of this can be blindness , paralysed muscles and anaphylactic shock which can be fatal.

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: End the right of Anglican Bishops to have 26 seats in the House of Lords.
attributes.background: Although only 15% British citizens are practising Anglicans, and this falls to 3% for those under 24. This is a continuing trend, yet the UK parliament allows 26 unelected Anglican Bishops to sit in the House of Lords. This privileged, undemocratic, discriminatory, anachronism cannot continue.
attributes.additional_details: The right of Church of England Bishops to sit in the House of Lords is a tradition that continues from mediaeval times. The UK is the only parliament in the world that accords a unique privileged status to religious representatives. Known as 'Lords Spiritual' these 26 Church of England Bishops occupy a position of political power that is no longer relevant in a country where so few identify with the Anglican church. If Bishops wish to represent UK people, why should they not stand for election?

attributes.action: Force the Government to fully fund the RNLI
attributes.background: in Britain we are one of the few countries that do not fund the Royal National lifeboat Association  and it is a scandal that we have to donate to something that should be provided as a government funded service.
attributes.additional_details: I was recently told by a lifeboat crew member that the service costs about £160m a year to finance, this is a a tiny amount when you look at government spending on say consultants, why are we allowing this travesty to continue.

attributes.action: Air travellers: punish drunken and/or violent and/or threatening behaviour.
attributes.background: To apply within the confines of an airport, or on board an aircraft (especially where this threatens the safety of the aircraft, crew or passengers).  A mandatory 2-year ban from flying with any airline operating flights from the U.K., 5 years for a second offence, a life ban for any third offence.
attributes.additional_details: People arrested for drunkenness on planes has doubled in the last year.

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can’t intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: Install security checkpoints at every underground transport station in the U.K.
attributes.background: Given the increasing prevalence of terror attacks in major U.K. cities, discuss reforms of national transport security policy. Initially install baggage scanners and metal detectors at underground stations and conduct random searches (not based on profile) of passengers crossing station checkpoints.
attributes.additional_details: Global cities more densely populated than London require passengers to place large items on scanners before proceeding to trains and metros. Metal detectors are also used to detect weapons and explosives. It is currently too easy to bring dangerous articles into confined stations in the U.K. wherein likelihood of injury and fatality from terror incidents increases. Requiring random searches of passengers and staff entering these stations could also mitigate the possibility of unfair profiling.

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.

attributes.action: Make Changing Places mandatory in the large public places listed in BS 8300:2009
attributes.background: Changing Places provide all the equipment that severely disabled people need, such as ceiling hoist, adult sized changing bed, centrally placed toilet, and adequate space. Changing Places are RECOMMENDED in BS 8300:2009, but should be mandatory so disabled people can be equal members of society.
attributes.additional_details: BS 8300:2009 RECOMMENDS that Changing Places should be built in large public places such as Shopping Centres, airports, leisure centres, sports stadiums, town halls, and auditoria, to name but a few. Disabled people often have to be changed on dirty toilet floors which is degrading, unhygienic and dangerous. Many disabled people choose to stay at home because the facilities they need do not exist in their community. Changing Places should be mandatory as they are a necessity for severely disabled people.

attributes.action: Introduce a visa esta or esa system (like Canada/USA) for non-eu visitors to UK
attributes.background: Currently, USA, Canada and Australia require foreign visitors (including British people) to complete a visa entry application prior to travel. Anybody with a historical criminal record must apply for a police certificate and await clearance from those countries, before being allowed entry.
attributes.additional_details: Britons are being refused entry to Canada and Australia particularly, for historic criminal records - even childhood cautions and less serious records -such as drink driving twenty years ago. A similar system should exist in the UK to vet potential visitors from non-eu countries.

attributes.action: Make hoax callers to emergency services pay £200 fine or a prison sentence
attributes.background: Over the past year, Wiltshire emergency services had over 1,000 hoax calls, and because they have a duty of care, they have to go to every call, so whilst there attending the hoax calls, there's hundreds of people that need an ambulance
attributes.additional_details: I believe, making sure every hoax call is investigated properly, there there should be a £200 fine or a prison sentence,  and if it's a child doing it, then the parents should pay it, or the child do some kind of community service,

attributes.action: I would like to see it a legal requirement for cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: It would just make life alot simpler for vets & owners .If something happened to your cat at least you would know instead of forever hoping 😢
attributes.additional_details: I run the group our pets uk and it's very sad the amount of cats that are killed in accidents , if they were microchipped owners would be notified .Cats do stray and would be easier to reunite with owners

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action: Ban non biodegradable plastic in food/drink packaging. Switch to hemp plastic.
attributes.background: Most drink bottles, tubs and other food packaging are made from petroleum based plastic. This is are toxic to the environment and takes 1000's of years (if ever) to break down. It is polluting the oceans and soil. Eco friendly biodegradable hemp plastic exists but is currently not being used.
attributes.additional_details:
Every week we (in the UK) bury 1000's of tonnes of plastic food and drink packaging. 
More makes its way into the rivers and oceans. It causes massive pollution harming both us and wildlife.
There is an environmentally friendly alternative. Hemp based plastic exists, but at the moment it is not used. 
Mostly because it is not well known about and there is no major manufacturing of it like there is for petroleum based plastics.
For our health and the environment we should make its use mandatory.
